metadata.title: CVE-2023-0597 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw possibility of memory leak in the Linux kernel cpu_entry_areamapping of X86 CPU data to memory was found in the way user can guesslocation of exception stack(s) or other important data. A local user coulduse this flaw to get access to some important data with expected locationin memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0597` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-79-generic - 5.15.0-79.86
linux-image-5.15.0-79-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-79.86
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-79-generic - 5.15.0-79.86
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-79-generic-64k - 5.15.0-79.86
No subscription required
